intro: Ervatamia nemoralis, commonly known as the common whitebeak, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Ervatamia nemoralis is often found in temperate regions of Europe and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
